text: If nothing else, this spells out a bit of what real Democratic voters tend to think "electability" means, and outlines the challenge for Bernie in continuing to expand his support.
author: gdebenedetti

text:
one interesting finding from the new CNN poll:
• 51% of Dem voters think they have a better chance at winning WH if the nominee is Biden, vs 36% someone else
• 33% think they have a better shot with Bernie, vs 56% someone else
http://cdn.cnn.com/cnn/2019/images/03/19/rel4b.-.2020.pdf …
author: gdebenedetti

text: ...but the least covered/understood trend continues to be Biden's gains: his lead in the early voting states is widening, according to these @MorningConsult numbers.
author: gdebenedetti

text: Another data point for the totally rational "was Beto's launch the worst disaster in history or the greatest weekend anyone's ever seen?" war: @MorningConsult shows him with just a 1-point national bump post-announcement (Sanders got +6, Harris +4 when they launched)...
author: gdebenedetti

text: "OTTUMWA, Ia. —The Iowa caucus season is reviving a century-old story, about a long-lost town near here where thousands of African-American miners from the South lived side-by-side with poor white immigrants from Europe."
author: gdebenedetti

text: People. Why on earth would I make this up? Here's the full Sanders email.
author: gdebenedetti

text: Anyway, if Klobuchar (and maybe others? Anyone seen other fundraiser invites asking for $5,600?) is raising money for both the primary and general, beware of initial fundraising numbers being touted by campaigns... you can’t actually use general election $ in the primary.
author: gdebenedetti

text: if she's indeed asking for donations of up to $5,600, it means she's raising money for both the primary and general. there's a legal distinction! it means that if she doesn't end up as the nominee, she'll have to return the $ given over the $2,800 primary limit...
author: gdebenedetti

text: I think it's pretty safe to conclude at this point that including the word "Beto" in your fundraising emails' subject line is a good way to get clicks/eyeballs/$. That's solely based on the number of candidates who've done it in the last few days who, y'know, aren't named Beto.
author: gdebenedetti
